references.paper_title: Multiple View Geometry in Computer Vision
references.reason: This book is a foundational text in computer vision, providing essential background on the geometric principles underlying multi-view geometry, including trifocal tensors, which are central to this paper.

references.paper_title: Photo Tourism: Exploring photo collections in 3D
references.reason: This paper introduced the Photo Tourism datasets, which are used as benchmarks for structure-from-motion algorithms in this paper, providing real-world data for evaluating the performance of the proposed synchronization method.
This paper provides a comprehensive overview of structure-from-motion techniques, comparing incremental and global approaches, and is used as a baseline for the presented algorithm.

references.paper_title: Robust camera location estimation by convex programming
references.reason: This paper presents a state-of-the-art global synchronization method for camera location estimation, which serves as a baseline for comparison in the experiments.

references.paper_title: A new rank constraint on multi-view fundamental matrices, and its application to camera location recovery
references.reason: This paper introduces a novel rank constraint on multi-view fundamental matrices, which is closely related to the low-rankness property of the block trifocal tensor explored in this paper, providing relevant theoretical insights.
